news.title: U.S. payrolls increased 139,000 in May, more than expected; unemployment at 4.2%
news.summary: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase 125,000 in May. The unemployment rate stayed at 4.2%. The economy is expected to grow by 0.3% in the second half of the year.

news.title: Trump 'not interested' in call with Musk, White House official says
news.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and President Trump launched a war of words at each other Thursday over Musk's criticism of the Republican's "One Big, Beautiful" tax bill.

news.title: Musk vs. Trump drama dominated in DC, but Germany's Merz quietly walked away with a win
news.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz met with U.S. President Donald Trump. Merz had a full agenda as he met with the president.

news.title: Tesla climbs in premarket trading as stock reels from Trump-Musk drama
news.summary: The electric vehicle maker lost $152 billion in market cap Thursday as traders reacted to a public feud between Elon Musk and President Donald Trump. The market cap of the company was $1.2 trillion.

news.title: Corporate layoffs have ramped up in recent weeks. Here are the companies making cuts
news.summary: Many companies lumped layoffs in with larger cost-cutting strategies. Some have cited artificial intelligence as a factor in layoffs. Some companies have cited Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a reason for layoffs.

news.title: You can find real stock-market bargains now — if you’re willing to break with tradition
news.summary: These ETFs take you far from the U.S. market. These funds are focused on Europe, Asia and the Middle East. They are not focused on the United States, however.

news.title: After a public breakup, Trump and Musk may — or may not — be ready to tone down their spat. Tesla shares are rebounding.
news.summary: White House staffers reportedly organized a telephone call between President Trump and Tesla CEO Elon Musk to keep Thursday’s public row from spiraling out of control.

news.title: AI is out to control your wallet. Why you’ll need to future-proof your money.
news.summary: AI is ready to take over our wallets. What could possibly go wrong? Plenty, as it turns out. Here's how to get your hands on one.

news.title: This investment turned $50,000 into $23 million in 10 years. Here’s why it’s still a buy.
news.summary: Bitcoin is here to save your money from inflation and central-bank meddling. If you notice in time, you'll be able to use it to pay your bills.

news.title: May jobs report shows soft 139,000 increase in new workers. Trade wars sap hiring.
news.summary: The number of new jobs created in May slowed to 139,000, a sign the Trump trade wars are starting to make a dent in a resilient U.S. labor market.
